"A.P.241/？/？/？":
"Oh, <%me>!
We were just talking
about you. Come here!"

"We're going to involve Senpai
in a conversation about Senpai...
You know no fear, Hitsugi."

"That said, you've wanted to
talk to <%me> too, right Io?
You have that look on your face."

"..More inportantly, why
doesn't Hitsugi address
Senpai in a more respectful way?"

"Eh? Now that you've mentioned it...
I'm pretty sure I did back then,
Xiera included."

"...I wonder when I stopped
doing so? I guess it just
happened after... a while?"

"We both agreed to not address each
other as such, however, maybe you
should add in more respect for
Senpai? Senpai did save your life, right?"

"You do have a point, Io...
Then let's pick one!"
"Pick one?"

"<%me>, you decide
how you would want to be addressed as!"

"It's too late for something that formal.
So it would feel weak. This is where we go with
something such as \"Sama\" or \"King\"..."
"Just what is Senpai to you, Hitsugi?"
"1. I like \"Sama\""
"2. I like \"King\""
"3. I like \"Senpai\""

"I see, so \"Sama\".
<%me>-sama!"

"Huh, didn't we hear that
somewhere before?"
"From Katori..."

"Okay, \"King..\"
Our Majesty <%me>!
How's that sound?"
"...Doesn't that sound embarressing?"
"So? It's from the Medieval period, but I like it."
"That's a bit.."

"Senpai!
That feels a bit off."

"No, that's not it.
Senpai is Senpai."

"That sounds weird to me.
We're right back where we
started from, so..."

"I hate to be the one
who says it, but I
think it's too late."

"Bleh. Well, I don't care
anymore. I'm just going to call you how I normally would call you."
